results.byline: By Coral Davenport, Lisa Friedman and Brad Plumer
results.title: California to Ban the Sale of New Gasoline Cars
results.abstract: The decision, to take effect by 2035, will very likely speed a wider transition to electric vehicles because many other states follow California’s standards.

media.caption: The San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge. At least 12 other states are already in line to adopt California’s zero-emissions vehicle mandate.

results.adx_keywords: Student Loans;Colleges and Universities;Personal Finances;Income Tax;Pell Grants;Federal Aid (US);Executive Orders and Memorandums;Content Type: Service;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Education Department (US)
results.byline: By Ron Lieber and Tara Siegel Bernard
results.title: What You Need to Know About Biden’s Student Loan Forgiveness Plan
results.abstract: President Biden’s move means the student loan balances of millions of people could fall by as much as $20,000. This F.A.Q. explains how it will work.

media.caption: Queens College in Flushing. Not everyone with debt will qualify for the student loan forgiveness plan.
media.copyright: Jonah Markowitz for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Diaries;Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Decisions and Verdicts;Biden, Ashley (1981- );Biden, Joseph R Jr;Harris, Aimee (1982- );Kurlander, Robert (1963- );Project Veritas;Justice Department
results.byline: By Adam Goldman and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: Florida Pair Pleads Guilty in Theft of Biden’s Daughter’s Diary
results.abstract: Aimee Harris and Robert Kurlander admitted to participating in a conspiracy in which Ashley Biden’s diary ended up in the hands of the conservative group Project Veritas near the end of the 2020 campaign.

media.caption: Robert Kurlander, left, with his lawyer, Jonathan Kaplan, on Thursday. In court papers filed in connection with Mr. Kurlander’s plea, prosecutors directly tied Project Veritas to the theft of Ashley Biden’s items.
media.copyright: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Water;Skeletons;DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid);Global Warming;Forensic Science;Boats and Boating;Lake Mead
results.title: Authorities Identify Remains Found at Lake Mead
results.abstract: Two decades ago, a man vanished in the water in front of his children. This week, their DNA samples helped to identify his remains, among several discovered recently amid a drought.

media.caption: A decomposing barrel along the shores of Lake Mead, near the spot where a victim who appeared to die from a gunshot wound was discovered in another barrel.
media.copyright: Joe Buglewicz for The New York Times

results.title: Biden to Cancel $10,000 in Student Debt; Low-Income Students Are Eligible for More
results.abstract: The debt forgiveness comes after months of deliberations in the White House over fairness and fears that the plan could make inflation worse ahead of the midterm elections.

results.title: Death of Rep. Tom McClintock’s Wife Tied to White Mulberry Leaf
results.abstract: The Sacramento County Coroner’s Office said Lori McClintock died in December 2021 of dehydration caused by stomach inflammation from consuming the herbal remedy.

media.caption: Lori McClintock with her husband, Tom, in 2003, when he was running for governor of California. She died in December.

results.byline: By Liam Stack, Katherine Rosman and Jan Ransom
results.title: Yoga Chain Reaped Millions but Filed No Taxes for Years, Prosecutors Say
results.abstract: The founders of Yoga to the People, a once wildly successful business that closed in 2020, are accused of concealing their income from the Internal Revenue Service for years.

media.caption: Yoga to the People, founded in Manhattan’s East Village, accepted donations and appealed to the city’s hip and budget conscious.

results.byline: By Kate Golembiewski and François Brunelle
results.title: Your Doppelgänger Is Out There and You Probably Share DNA With Them
results.abstract: That person who looks just like you is not your twin, but if scientists compared your genomes, they might find a lot in common.

media.caption: Charlie Chasen and Michael Malone, Atlanta, 2014.

results.adx_keywords: Dogs;Dementia;Research;your-feed-science;your-feed-animals;Scientific Reports (Journal)
results.title: Will Your Dog Get Dementia? A Large New Study Offers Clues.
results.abstract: The risk of canine cognitive dysfunction, a.k.a. “doggy dementia,” is far greater in dogs who don’t get enough exercise, researchers found. Their risk factors echo some in humans, whose homes they share.

media.caption: Dante, an 11-year-old Bernese mountain dog who has been diagnosed with canine cognitive dysfunction, at Cass Park in Ithaca, N.Y. on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Heather Ainsworth for The New York Times

results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Email Shows Early Tension Between Trump and National Archives
results.abstract: The archives reached out to lawyers for the former president less than four months after he left office last year seeking help in recovering missing material.

media.caption: The National Archives was particularly looking for correspondence between former President Donald J. Trump and North Korea’s leader, and a letter former President Barack Obama had left in the Oval Office for Mr. Trump.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.title: RM, Boy Band Superstar, Embraces New Role: Art Patron
results.abstract: The BTS leader has been championing canonical artists from his native South Korea — studying their work, buying it and sometimes talking to it. “I feel like they’re watching me,” he said.

media.caption: “I think that there’s something that I can offer as an outsider of the art industry,” RM said.

results.title: Dogs Attack and Kill Mail Carrier in Florida, Officials Say
results.abstract: Pamela Jane Rock had been out delivering mail when her vehicle broke down in Putnam County, Fla. Then, five dogs attacked her, the authorities said.

media.caption: The Putnam County Sheriff’s Office provided this picture of the dogs.

results.title: The Public Life of the Kardashians’ Private Chef
results.abstract: Chef K has worked with some of the biggest celebrities. Now she’s taking center stage.

media.caption: Khristianne Uy, a private chef known as Chef K, has spent the last several years working on the margins of the Kardashians. But now, she is stepping into the frame — on TikTok.
